revised_title: On the Effects of Pressure in Producing Polarized Images and Colors in Soft Transparent Solids
tldr: The author discovered that soft transparent solids, like animal jellies, can exhibit the optical properties of doubly polarizing crystals when subjected to pressure. This phenomenon can be observed through the depolarization of light and the appearance of complementary colors. The author conducted various experiments with different types of jellies and pressures to demonstrate this effect.
